en.purpose: This score can be used to assign priority to liver transplant candidates younger than 12 years old. It is an update to the prior PELD score and was adopted by OPTN in July 2023.
en.use:
Similar to the MELD score, but for pediatrics: determines prognosis and prioritizes receipt of liver transplantation.
Should be used in pediatric patients under age 12 for risk stratification and transplant prioritization. 
PELD Cr was adopted as the new standard for liver transplantation priority by the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network (OPTN) in the United States in July 2023.
PELD Cr includes creatinine for better risk stratification. 
The previous version of PELD was thought to underestimate mortality by as much as 17% and up to 66% of transplant candidates were listed with a medical exception (due to inadequacy of the prior formula in capturing medical severity).
The PELD Cr score includes creatinine to capture the degree of renal dysfunction, which is an independent predictor of 90-day mortality for pediatric candidates on the transplant list. 
This score also updates growth failure from a categorical to continuous variable and adjustment factor for age.
en.misuse: Not to be used for ages >11 years old

gt0001.description:
Updates PELD model as standard for pediatric liver transplant planning.
A higher PELD Cr score is associated with greater severity of liver disease.
